availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas S. Walton (Barren County, Kentucky, farmer and justice of the peace)

body.p: Barren County, Kentucky, farmer and justice of the peace. Virginia native. Married to Mary C. Hatton Walton. Father of Henry W. Walton, Louisa A. Walton, John Copeland Walton, James C. Walton, Dundridge S. Walton, Elizabeth M. Walton, and Thomas G. Walton. Merchant in Barren County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned two enslaved persons in Barren County in 1850. Farmer in Barren County in 1860. Justice of the peace in Barren County in 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Barren County, Division 2, p. 433A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Barren County, Division 2, p. 210.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Barren County, District 1, p. 183-4.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hart County, Caverna, p. 258A.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File #24073.
"Thomas Shirley Walton (1813-1909)," Find A Grave, Memorial #136874924, accessed September 8, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/136874924.
